snippet: Re-enactments of life more than a century ago, including a gunfight performance that went awry, keep the small Arizona city booming.
abstract: Historic re-creations of 1880s gun battles in Old West town of Tombstone, Ariz, bring tens of thousands of visitors to historic outpost each year; October 2015 incident, in which live ammunition was accidentally used in prop gun, injuring mock deputy Ken Curtis, had shut down mock gun battles for months; actors are now back to their routines, much to relief of town that relies on single-theme tourism.
lead_paragraph: Re-enactments of life more than a century ago, including a gunfight performance that went awry, keep the small Arizona city booming.

headline.main: Guns Blazing, Tombstone Is Back to Its Past
headline.print_headline: Guns Blazing, Tombstone Is Back to Its Past
